Class OrderMapper

java.lang.Object
com.cafe.backend.entity.mapper.OrderMapper
public class OrderMapper extends Object
The OrderMapper is a utility class used for converting between OrderEntity and OrderDTO.

It handles the transformation of full order data, including embedded product information, discount, tip, status, and relationships with users and cafeterias.

This class is commonly used in the service layer to prepare entities for persistence or DTOs for API responses.

  • Method Details

    • mapToDTO

      public static OrderDTO mapToDTO(OrderEntity orderEntity) throws DataMappingException
      Converts an OrderEntity into an OrderDTO, including order products and calculated total price.
      Parameters:
      orderEntity - The entity to be converted.
      Returns:
      A fully populated OrderDTO.
      Throws:
      DataMappingException - if the entity is null or a nested mapping fails.

    • mapToEntity

      public static OrderEntity mapToEntity(OrderDTO orderDTO) throws DataMappingException
      Converts an OrderDTO into an OrderEntity for persistence.

      Note: This method builds a partial entity with the assumption that related user and cafeteria entities will be set elsewhere in the business logic.

      Parameters:
      orderDTO - The DTO to be converted.
      Returns:
      A basic OrderEntity with core fields set.
      Throws:
      DataMappingException - if the DTO is null.
